variant.question: The equatorial easterly jet is a jet stream that occurs

options.text: only during the summer in the Northern hemisphere at approximately 45 000 ft.
only during the winter in the Northern hemisphere at approximately 30 000 ft.
during the whole year in the Northern hemisphere.
during the whole year in the Southern hemisphere.

variant.question: The most likely place to encounter clear air turbulence associated with a jet stream :

options.text:
Close to the core on the side facing the polar
air
5000 feet or more above the core
On the tropical side of the core

variant.question: Which jet stream blows all year round, over the northern hemisphere?
Which phenomenon is often associated with a jet stream?
Where are the jet streams typically located?

options.text: At the tropopause where intensified temperature gradients are located.
In a single continuous band, encircling the Earth, where there is a break between the equatorial and polar tropopause.
In areas of strong low pressure systems in the stratosphere.
In areas of strong high pressure systems in the stratosphere.

variant.question: Which of the following types of jet streams can be observed all year round?

options.text: Subtropical jet stream / Polar front jet stream.
Equatorial jet stream / Polar front jet stream.
Equatorial jet stream / Arctic jet stream.
Arctic jet stream / Subtropical jet stream.

variant.question: The normal average speeds of the Polar front jet stream are in the region of:

options.text: 150 kts in January / 135 kts in July.
150 kts in July / 50 kts in January.
150 kts in July / 135 kts in January.
135 kts in July / 135 kts in January.

variant.question: (Refer to Annex) What name is given to the jet stream lying across India (A)?
What jet streams are likely to be crossed during a flight from Stockholm to Rio de Janeiro (23° S) at FL350 in July?

options.text: A polar front jet stream followed by one or two subtropical jet streams.
A polar front jet stream followed by a subtropical jet stream and later, a second polar front jet stream.
A subtropical jet stream followed by a polar front jet stream.

variant.question: At approximately what altitude is the subtropical jet stream found over Europe?
At what flight level is the jet stream core that is situated over Germany?
The jet stream and associated Clear Air Turbulence can sometimes be visually identified in flight by

options.text: dust or haze at high level.
a high-pressure center at high level.

variant.question: Which cloud type may frequently be associated with jet streams?

options.text: CI cloud band on the equatorial side of the jet stream.
CS cloud layer on the polar side and under the jet stream.
CI cloud band on the polar side of the jet stream.
CB cloud line where the jet stream crosses a cold front.

variant.question:
Flight Munich to London
 What is the direction and maximum speed of the jet stream affecting the route between Munich and London?
At what flight level can we expect to encounter a core of the jet stream situated over northern Scandinavia?
You cross a jet stream in horizontal flight at approximately right angles. While crossing, in spite of a strong wind of 120 kts, you notice the temperature barely changes.

options.text: This phenomenon is absolutely normal as you are crossing the jet core.
This phenomenon does not surprise you at all, since normally no large temperature differences are possible at these heights.
You assume the front associated with the jet stream to be very weak with practically no temperature difference between the two airmasses.
Since the result of such readings seems impossible, you will after landing have the instruments tested.

variant.question: What is the average height of the jet core within a polar front jet stream?
What is the average height of the jet core within a polar front jet stream?
A wind speed of 350 kts within a jet stream core should be regarded as (worldwide)

options.text: possible but a very rare phenomenon.

variant.question: Most strong air currents at higher levels (jet streams) have a westerly direction. There is, however,  an important easterly jet  stream. When and where is it likely to be encountered?

options.text:
In summer from south-east Asia extending over southern
India to central Africa.

Throughout the year to the south of the Azorian
high.

In summer from the Middle East extending over the
southern part of the Mediterranean to southern Spain.

In winter along the Russian coast facing the Arctic
ocean.
